caller_intent: Jerry Mason is reporting a discrepancy in his auto insurance coverage, claiming two of his four vehicles are no longer insured despite paying $1500, and is concerned about potential legal issues due to lack of coverage.
resolution_steps: Agent Addison confirms the Haggerty policy includes a 2001 Chevrolet and 1996 Mercedes.
Notices the $1500 payment was for National General covering a 2021 Ram and 2023 Hyundai.
Identifies a potential gap in communication with Cecilia regarding the Haggerty policy.
Plans to contact Cecilia to investigate the application process and billing discrepancy.
Agrees to follow up with Jerry after resolving the policy and billing issues.
knowledge_required: Understanding of insurance policy structures and coverage details
Communication with third-party agents (e.g., Cecilia) to resolve application discrepancies
summary: Jerry Mason contacted Alliance Insurance to resolve confusion about his auto insurance coverage, where two vehicles appeared uninsured despite payments. Agent Addison clarified the policies involved, identified a billing mix-up between National General and Haggerty, and committed to contacting Cecilia to resolve the application gap. The call ended with a promise to follow up after investigating the billing issue.
